business.headline: India–US trade deal advances with focus on finalising legal agreementSpeaking on the development, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal said a joint statement outlining the contours of the agreement has already been signed. He said that these contours now need to be converted into a formal legal agreement.

Record MSP procurement: How many farmers are actually benefiting?India's MSP system is clearly expanding, with higher spending, larger procurement and more beneficiaries than before. Yet the debate has shifted from scale to security.
Sensex rallies over 600 points: Why stock market rose today?The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 650.39 points to close at 83,277.15, while the NSE Nifty50 added 211.65 points to end at 25,682.75.

How cash levels in mutual funds impact returns during volatile marketsIn the current market, volatility caused by global and external factors has led some mutual funds to increase their cash positions. The idea is to lower risk and protect portfolios from sudden corrections.

Can NPS help you save tax in the new regime? What salaried employees must knowFor salaried workers who have moved to the new tax regime, tax saving can feel limited. This has led many to question if there are still practical ways to ease their tax burden. Let's have a look.

Can your employer refuse gratuity if you get pension? Here's what employees must knowMany employees assume that receiving a pension from their employer means they may have to give up gratuity. But the law draws a clear distinction between the two. A recent court ruling has clarified what workers should know about their rights.

Why Mumbai remains India's top luxury housing hubThe global recognition Mumbai is receiving today is best understood as validation rather than arrival. International research now ranks the city among the world's fastest-growing luxury housing markets, reflecting sustained price appreciation at the very top end.

Using old tax regime? Here's how draft income tax rules 2026 could help you save moreIf you are still using the old income tax regime, the government's draft rules for 2026 may bring some welcome relief. Proposed changes to key exemptions and allowances could slightly lower your tax bill and make the traditional regime more rewarding.

RBI move hits Dalal Street stocks: BSE, Groww fall up to 10%. Here's whyThe selling pressure came after the RBI issued a revised circular on February 13 under its amended RBI (Commercial Banks – Credit Facilities) Directions. The new rules change how banks can lend to entities involved in the capital markets.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as market sentiment remain cautious over IT selloffThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 47.79 points to 82,578.97, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7.45 points to 25,464.75 as of 9:48 am.

Man paid Rs 50,000 a year premium, insurance claim denied when mother fell illThe man said he had been paying around Rs 50,000 every year for his mother's policy and when she needed treatment, he went to the Lucknow office of Star Health and Allied Insurance, where he alleged he was made to wait for hours. His claim was denied.

Budget without populism and with capital outlays powers growth, jobs: PMDescribing the Budget for the fiscal year starting April 1 as reflective of his governance approach, PM Modi said the document is a good reflection of our governance style and priorities.

Have Rs 5,000? Here's why an emergency fund should come before your SIPYou've heard the advice, i.e., "Start a SIP immediately." But is that the smartest first move with Rs 5,000? The choice might surprise you.

Will AI change how you invest your money in stocks and mutual funds?The next market shift may not come from earnings or interest rates. It may come from AI. In this article, we explore how it could reshape your stock and mutual fund investments.

Air India fined Rs 1 crore for flying Airbus 8 times without airworthiness permitThe DGCA has imposed a fine of about Rs 1 crore on Air India for flying an Airbus aircraft eight times without a valid airworthiness permit. The aviation watchdog also said the lapse further eroded public trust in the airline.

Why personalised loans are becoming the go-to option in 2026The journey of hyper-personalisation in personal loans is going to get more exciting for customers with the increasing adoption of technology refining customer offerings, based on minute details of the customers.

RBI plans to update Kisan Credit Card rules : 5 key changes to trackThe Reserve Bank of India is preparing to overhaul the Kisan Credit Card scheme, and the proposed changes could reshape how farmers borrow and repay loans. With the new draft rules on the table, what exactly is set to change for farm credit?

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's market bloodbath?The market opened on a weak note and remained under pressure throughout the session, with losses deepening in the second half. The decline appeared to be driven by profit booking at elevated levels and a cautious mood among investors amid global uncertainties.

Reliance wins US licence for Venezuelan oil as India wavers on Russia supplyReliance applied for the licence in early January as India looks to diversify its energy purchases. Direct purchase of Venezuelan oil will help Reliance replace Russian oil in a cost-effective way.

Cheque bounced? How one mistake can spiral into legal and financial troubleA bounced cheque may seem like a minor slip, but it can quickly trigger penalties, credit damage and even legal complications. What starts as a simple payment error can snowball into a serious financial setback. Are you aware of the risks?

entertainment.headline: Robert Duvall, Oscar-winning star of The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, dies at 95 Known for subtle, authentic performances, Robert Duvall emerged as one of cinema's most respected actors. He won the Academy Award for best actor in 1983 for his portrayal of a washed-up country singer in Tender Mercies, a role regarded as a masterclass in understated performance.

Patralekhaa supports husband Rajkummar Rao as his weight gain sparks talk Actor Patralekhaa defends Rajkummar Rao after his weight gain draws online chatter, revealing the intense transformation behind his latest biopic.

HIT director Sailesh Kolanu steps into rom-com space with Emo Emo Idi, first look out Director Sailesh Kolanu takes a creative turn with his first romantic entertainer Emo Emo Idi. The film explores Gen Z love and is set for a Dussehra 2026 release.

Arijit Singh retired because he got tired of singing the same song: Anurag Kashyap Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap reacts to Arijit Singh's retirement announcement, suggesting the singer was weary of repeating the same heartbreak template.

Suhas' Hey Bhagawan retitled Hey Balwanth after censor objection Actor Suhas' comedy faces a last-minute title change after a censor objection. Here's why Hey Bhagawan became Hey Balwanth just days before release.

Sivakarthikeyan, Kamal Haasan reunite for rural drama, first look poster out Tamil actor Sivakarthikeyan announced his new film Seyon under Kamal Haasan's banner. The film explores rural themes with cultural symbolism, marking a fresh collaboration after Amaran's success.

Mani Ratnam praises Shanaya Kapoor, Adarsh Gourav's Tu Yaa Main Veteran filmmaker Mani Ratnam praised Bejoy Nambiar's survival thriller Tu Yaa Main, which released in theatres on February 13. The film stars Adarsh Gourav and Shanaya Kapoor in the lead.

Charak: Fair of Faith teaser raises chilling doubts on blind belief Sudipto Sen unveils the teaser for Charak: Fair of Faith, a folklore thriller that delves into the unsettling grey zones between belief and blind devotion.

Norwegian-Nigerian singer Tolou wants to collaborate with singer Ankur Tewari Norwegian-Nigerian singer Tolou performed at Lollapalooza India, sharing her debut album ENERGY with a new audience. Her music's blend of cultures sparked joyful connection and highlighted emotional melody's universal appeal.

Meera Jasmine joins Mohanlal in L 366, character poster unveiled Mohanlal and Meera Jasmine reunite on screen in the upcoming film L 366. The movie marks Mohanlal's return as a cop and strengthens his collaboration with director Tharun Moorthy.

Rajkummar Rao reacts to fan's plea to avoid propaganda films Rajkummar Rao recently reacted to a fan's polite request who asked him to avoid making propaganda films. The actor's reply has won many hearts.

Jailer 2 release date likely postponed to August after Rajinikanth wraps shooting Rajinikanth has completed his portions for Jailer 2, with the film's release now expected in August. The potential date shift could place the film in a competitive release window against other major titles.

Today, Akshay and I are friends, Shilpa and I are friends: Raveena Tandon Actor Raveena Tandon opened up about her past with Akshay Kumar and Shilpa Shetty, revealing how time has reshaped old headlines into mature friendships.

Vijay Sethupathi's Soodhu Kavvum to re-release in theatres February 20 Vijay Sethupathi's cult Tamil film Soodhu Kavvum is set to re-release on February 20. The move revives interest in the black comedy as fans await its return at an affordable ticket price.

Pankaj Tripathi shares stage with daughter in La Ilaaj at NSD's Bharat Rang Mahotsav After 12 years, Pankaj Tripathi returns to theatre with the musical La Ilaaj sharing stage with his daughter Aashi. The play's live music and themes of love highlight his deep connection to theatre and hopes to inspire new audiences.

Yash upset over Toxic-Dhurandhar 2 clash, stands firm on March 19 release date Yash is firm on releasing Toxic on March 19 despite a clash with Dhurandhar 2. Yash is reportedly upset over the lack of courtesy from the Dhurandhar team regarding the release date conflict.

Rahul Bhat on working with Anurag Kashyap in Kennedy: Never been his first choice Actor Rahul Bhat opened up about reuniting with Anurag Kashyap for Kennedy, revealing why this collaboration felt inevitable from the start.

Kanye West announces first India concert, to perform in Delhi. Check ticket details Kanye West, also known as Ye, has announced his debut performance in India. The rapper's India concert is set to take place in New Delhi on March 29.

Vijay-Rashmika wedding: Udaipur ceremony, Hyderabad reception and all we know Actors Vijay and Rashmika are all set to get married in an intimate Udaipur ceremony followed by a grand reception in Hyderabad. The wedding blends Telugu and Coorgi customs and has attracted wide attention from fans and film industry insiders alike.

general news.headline: Three US-sanctioned ships linked to Iran seized by India near Mumbai: ReportThe vessels were intercepted about 100 nautical miles off Mumbai and escorted for investigation, as authorities move to prevent ship-to-ship transfers and curb sanctions evasion in Indian waters.

Boyfriend tried to summon Indore MBA student's spirit after murdering her: CopsPolice said the accused fled to Maharashtra after the murder, allegedly destroyed the victim's phone and attempted occult rituals in a hotel room to call her soul. The man has been arrested days after the crime and is being interrogated.

Dirty water or needles? Fear in Haryana village after string of hepatitis deathsA sense of dread hangs over Chhainsa village in Haryana, where families say illness has entered almost every home. While the administration hunts for Hepatitis cases, villagers ask why so many fell sick in the first place.

Kalli Purie pitches 9-point charter for fair AI use in media at AI Impact SummitSpeaking at the India AI Impact Summit, Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief of the India Today Group, noted that use of AI in media should be based on fairness, accountability and reciprocity.

A new East India Company rising? Rubio's speech signals US colonial aspirationAt the Munich Security Conference, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio called on the West to compete for "market share in the economies of the Global South" as part of building a "new Western century". Critics point to the coloniser tone in Rubio's speech and ask countries like India to criticise it.

3, including gunman, killed in shooting at ice rink in Rhode Island Police said three victims remain in critical condition after a shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena in Pawtucket. Authorities believe the incident was targeted and possibly linked to a family dispute.

Not the same woman: Conspiracy theories explode over Ghislaine Maxwell prison videoA prison deposition video of Ghislaine Maxwell has sparked widespread online rumours of a body double. Screenshots quickly spread across social media, prompting side-by-side comparisons with older photographs and claims of differences in her appearance.

PM kicks off India AI summit, visits startup stalls on opening dayPM Modi walked through the India-AI Impact Summit venue, stopping frequently at stalls, speaking to founders and asking detailed questions about products and real-world applications of AI.

Suryakumar Yadav asked teammates not to sledge Pakistan, BCCI releases BTS videoIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav instructed his team to avoid sledging during their T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan. The disciplined approach helped India secure a commanding 61-run victory and qualify for the Super 8 stage.

Pathum Nissanka's Pallekele century leaves Australia in danger of early exitT20 World Cup 2026: Pathum Nissanka's blazing century powered Sri Lanka to an eight-wicket win over Australia, sealing a Super 8 berth and ending a three-year wait for victory over the Aussies in the shortest format.

Scientist skeptical of Havana syndrome tests audio weapon, suffers brain damageA Norwegian scientist tested a prototype microwave device on himself and developed symptoms like Havana syndrome. This experiment has intensified debate among US officials about the role of directed-energy technology in unexplained illnesses.

Vaibhav Sooryavanshi skips Class 10 Board exams, joins RR for IPL 2026India's teenage cricket sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi will not appear for his Class 10 board exams this year. His focus remains on IPL 2026 preparations after a stellar U19 World Cup performance.

Robert Duvall, Oscar-winning star of The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, dies at 95Known for subtle, authentic performances, Robert Duvall emerged as one of cinema's most respected actors. He won the Academy Award for best actor in 1983 for his portrayal of a washed-up country singer in Tender Mercies, a role regarded as a masterclass in understated performance.

Backlash over Bill Gates's Andhra Pradesh reception amid Epstein Files furyMicrosoft co-founder Bill Gates reached Andhra Pradesh as part of his India trip and was welcomed by state minister Nara Lokesh. The reception came in for criticism online because of messages linking Gates to convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein. Gates denied all links.

Macron arrives in Mumbai on India visit, AI and defence boost on agendaFrench President Emmanuel Macron's visit, scheduled from February 17 to 19, is at the invitation of Modi and includes participation in the AI Impact Summit as well as a bilateral summit in Mumbai. This is Macron's fourth visit to India and his first to Mumbai.

How can they have physical relations before marriage? Supreme Court's cautionThe Bench said "maybe we are old fashioned", observing that before marriage, a man and woman are strangers and urging greater caution in intimate relationships.

Man paid Rs 50,000 a year premium, insurance claim denied when mother fell illThe man said he had been paying around Rs 50,000 every year for his mother's policy and when she needed treatment, he went to the Lucknow office of Star Health and Allied Insurance, where he alleged he was made to wait for hours. His claim was denied.

Yunus resigns as interim chief ahead of Tarique Rahman's oath as Bangladesh PMMuhammad Yunus, who had been serving as chief adviser of the caretaker administration installed after Sheikh Hasina's departure, confirmed his decision in a farewell address to the nation ahead of the handover of power to the elected leadership.

Statement made by mistake: Tamil Nadu BJP chief apologises for remark on TrishaThe apology comes a day after Tamil Nadu BJP chief Nainar Nagendran triggered a political row by suggesting that Vijay should "come out of Trisha's house" to gain experience and succeed in politics.

Suryakumar Yadav, Kuldeep Yadav patch up after on-ground spat in Colombo: WatchT20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav and Kuldeep Yadav made up after their on-field spat during India's win over Pakistan, sharing a light-hearted video to show there is no rift in the camp.

If Claude writes all code, what will engineers do? Anthropic respondsAnthropic says nearly 100 per cent of its code is now generated by AI, so what are software engineers doing? According to Boris Cherny, head of Claude Code, while AI is handling most of the coding, humans have taken on new responsibilities, including guiding the systems, reviewing outputs and deciding what should be built next.

31.6 degrees in February: Delhi records hottest day of year, AQI stays poorAccording to the weather department, the Safdarjung monitoring station noted a sharp 24-hour temperature change of 3.1 degrees, indicating a sudden warm spell affecting the region.

In 2026 India, is Mysore silk saree the Birkin people queue up for at 4 am?Handcrafted ByOur Editors If you're someone who keeps track of viral videos, you would, by no means, have missed the clip of women queuing outside a store in Bengaluru at 4 am for a Mysore silk saree. But what's causing the demand? Has it gained a Birkin-like status among Indians?

3 get death penalty for gang-raping Israeli tourist, killing male tourist in HampiAn Israeli tourist and a Hampi homestay owner were raped, and another tourist from Odisha was killed by three men in Hampi last year. All three accused have been given the death penalty in the case.

sports.headline: How 2 ex-India coaches planned Australia's downfall in T20 World Cup Sri Lanka vs Australia: Co-hosts Sri Lanka qualified for the Super 8s by beating Australia in Pallekele. After the game, head coach Sanath Jayasuriya explained how two Indian coaches helped him shape this Sri Lankan side.

Matchday Preview: New Zealand hunt Super 8 spot, AFG stare at knockout ICC T20 World Cup: It is time for Matchday 11 in the T20 World Cup 2026. A couple of big games will decide the fate of the two very important teams in Group B and D.

Kohli would never give up: Dinesh Karthik rips into Babar Azam, ends GOAT debate Dinesh Karthik reignited the Kohli vs Babar debate after Pakistan's loss, calling Babar's shot "submission" and saying Virat Kohli would never give up under pressure.

Match vs AUS one of Sri Lanka's best performances in recent past: Shanaka T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka beat Australia in the T20 World Cup to qualify for the Super 8s. After the win, captain Dasun Shanaka called the game one of Sri Lanka's finest in the recent past.

Pathum Nissanka's Pallekele century leaves Australia in danger of early exit T20 World Cup 2026: Pathum Nissanka's blazing century powered Sri Lanka to an eight-wicket win over Australia, sealing a Super 8 berth and ending a three-year wait for victory over the Aussies in the shortest format.

Vaibhav Sooryavanshi skips Class 10 Board exams, joins RR for IPL 2026 India's teenage cricket sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi will not appear for his Class 10 board exams this year. His focus remains on IPL 2026 preparations after a stellar U19 World Cup performance.

Suryakumar Yadav, Kuldeep Yadav patch up after on-ground spat in Colombo: Watch T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav and Kuldeep Yadav made up after their on-field spat during India's win over Pakistan, sharing a light-hearted video to show there is no rift in the camp.

India had enough runs to enforce follow-on vs Pakistan: R Ashwin IND vs PAK: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin joked that India could have followed-on Pakistan in Colombo on Sunday. Ashwin's comments come after the India vs Pakistan match, where the Suryakumar Yadav side beat Pakistan by 61 runs.

England outlast resilient Italy to book Super 8 spot with win by 24 runs in Kolkata ENG vs ITA, T20 World Cup: England held their nerve to defeat spirited Italy by 24 runs at Eden Gardens, booking their Super 8 berth despite Ben Manenti's breathtaking 60, threatening a major upset in Kolkata.

Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi faces axe after humiliating defeat against India: Report IND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: It seems like the Pakistan management has had enough of Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi following their poor displays against India with the management reportedly set to drop the star duo in their upcoming game against Namibia.

Rashid Khan scripts history, becomes first bowler to take 700 T20 wicketsAfghanistan captain Rashid Khan became the first cricketer to claim 700 wickets in T20 cricket. His record-breaking feat helped Afghanistan secure a five-wicket win over UAE in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 group stage.

Abhishek Sharma will bounce back: Harbhajan backs batter after duck vs PAKT20 World Cup: Harbhajan Singh backed Abhishek Sharma to bounce back after two ducks in the T20 World Cup, including a four-ball duck vs Pakistan. The former spinner said Abhishek will deliver when India need him most.

All-round Azmat helps Afghanistan beat UAE, remain in Super 8s raceT20 World Cup: Azmatullah Omarzai's all-round brilliance has powered Afghanistan to a five-wicket win over UAE in New Delhi to remain in the race to reach the Super 8 stage of the T20 World Cup 2026.

New Zealand women start new era as Amelia Kerr appointed as all-format captainThe New Zealand women's team will usher in a new era as Amelia Kerr has been appointed as the new all-format captain of the side on Monday, February 16. Kerr takes over from Sophie Devine as the new skipper of the White Ferns.

Suryakumar Yadav asked teammates not to sledge Pakistan, BCCI releases BTS videoIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav instructed his team to avoid sledging during their T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan. The disciplined approach helped India secure a commanding 61-run victory and qualify for the Super 8 stage.

Death of a rivalry: Has India vs Pakistan lost its magic due to overexposure?T20 World Cup: Cricket's greatest rivalry has become its most overplayed fixture. The guaranteed group-stage meetings are killing the magic, stifling emerging teams, and turning spectacle into monotony.

Devdutt Padikkal puts selectors on alert with maiden double ton vs UttarakhandDevdutt Padikkal put India selectors on alert with his maiden first-class double century in the Ranji Trophy semi-final against Uttarakhand. The Karnataka captain's 232-run knock strengthened his case for a Test recall.

Steve Smith replaces Josh Hazlewood in Australia squad ahead of Sri Lanka clashSteve Smith has been named as a replacement for injured Josh Hazlewood in the Australia squad for the T20 World Cup 2026. His inclusion will strengthen Australia's batting as they prepare to face Sri Lanka in a crucial fixture.

Unable to digest defeat, Mohsin Naqvi leaves stadium midway through chaseAs Pakistan's middle-order collapsed against India in Colombo, Mohsin Naqvi decided to leave the stadium mid-way through the chase. India dominated Pakistan to secure a thumping 61-run win on Sunday, February 15.

Ex-Pakistan spinner mocks IND vs PAK Colombo rout: Boycott was betterT20 World Cup: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria mocked Pakistan's humiliating 61-run loss to India in Colombo. Kaneria suggested a boycott would have been less embarrassing as Pakistan's Super 8 hopes now hang by a thread.

AFG vs UAE Highlights: Afghanistan beat UAE by 5 wickets to stay in Super 8s raceAfghanistan (AFG) vs UAE (UAE), T20 World Cup Highlights: Afghanistan have kept their Super 8s dreams alive by beating UAE by 5 wickets in what turned out to be a thriller in New Delhi. Azmatullah Omarzai's all-round brilliance has given Afghanistan a glimmer of hope.

Like Kohli in Melbourne, Ishan Kishan finds cricket's loneliest place in ColomboT20 World Cup 2026: In Colombo against Pakistan, Ishan Kishan found cricket's loneliest place, the same space Virat Kohli once inhabited in Melbourne, but reached it through dominance rather than endurance.

India's C team will thrash Pakistan: Srikkanth calls for end of greatest rivalry hypeT20 World Cup: After Pakistan's surrender to India during the T20 World Cup 2026, Kris Srikkanth said that the Indian C team is enough to beat the arch-rivals. Srikkanth heavily criticised the Pakistan batting after the heavy defeat in Colombo.

A new low: When Pakistan lost to India as early as toss. Over and out.T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Pakistan had little go their way after choosing to bowl first in Colombo, where teams batting second have struggled throughout the tournament. Their decision backfired as Pakistan slumped to a 61-run defeat on Sunday.

Has Babar Azam ever played a Kohli-esque knock? Irfan Pathan slams PAK batterT20 World Cup: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has slammed Babar Azam after another flopshow against India, asking if he has ever played a knock like Virat Kohli in a pressure game. Babar was dismissed for five runs in Colombo.

Drop Babar, Shaheen, Shadab: Afridi goes on all-out rant after IND vs PAK lossT20 World Cup: Shahid Afridi has urged Pakistan to bench Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi and Shadab Khan after another heavy loss to India in Colombo. He wants youngsters trusted for the remaining T20 World Cup matches.

Abhishek Sharma gets key advice from Shastri on form revival after PAK failureT20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma was given key advice on how to turn his form around as his recent slump in form continued during the India vs Pakistan game on Sunday, February 15. Abhishek was dismissed for a duck during the match in Colombo.

Watch: Rohit Sharma hugs Pakistan legend Wasim Akram in ColomboT20 World Cup: Former India captain Rohit Sharma shared a warm hug with Pakistan legend Wasim Akram during the pre-match ceremony in Colombo. The moment went viral ahead of India's dominant 61-run win over Pakistan.

Incompetent, ignorant: Akhtar tears into PCB chief after India hammers PakIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar launched a scathing attack on PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi and senior players after Pakistan's 61-run loss to India, calling incompetent leadership "the biggest crime in the world."

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
